block.p: ISRAEL REACHING OUT TO U.S. It is clear that Israel's new leader places great importance on winning American support in his coming trip to the United States, but his Government problems are not helping his cause. A1

TENSE STANDOFF IN BOSNIA American peacekeepers had a tense standoff over the weekend with Bosnian Serbs, after they moved armored vehicles near the headquarters of their commander, who has been indicted for war crimes. A6

NEW GLOBAL WARMING CONCERN A United Nations report to be released during talks this week about global warming says there could be a wide range of threats to public health if action on the issue is taken too slowly. A2

ON AIDS, GOOD NEWS AND BAD As an international conference on AIDS opened, the United Nations said that the disease has been growing rapidly in India, but impressive gains in prevention have been made in some regions of the world. A3

WORLD FOCUS ON CORRUPTION A former World Bank official has formed an international organization that works to reduce corruption worldwide on the ground that corruption seriously undermines development in many countries. A3
JAPAN PRISONS DRAW COMPLAINTS In many ways, Japan has a model prison system, but prisoners and former prisoners are trying to sue, saying that draconian rules amount to human rights abuses. A6
A voter registration drive in a contra area of Nicaragua. A7
Gaborone Journal: In Botswana, where the ticker tape ambles. A4

H.M.O. RULES SHELVED After criticism from health maintenance organizations, the Clinton Administration has shelved rules that would have curbed the H.M.O. practice of rewarding doctors who cut costs by reducing services to Medicare and Medicaid patients. A1
NEW SYSTEM FOR TRACKING GUNS President Clinton is set to announce the creation of a Federal computer system to track the illegal sale of guns to young people. A1

DOLE AND THE ISSUE OF ABORTION Bob Dole's path to victory in 1974, in a bruising fight to retain his Senate seat, is a story of tremendous perseverance, and a story of the power of abortion as a political issue. A1
MORE TAPED TESTIMONY Sitting in the White House, the President gave a sworn videotaped deposition in the trial of two Arkansas bankers. A11

WHITEWATER LINK TO FILES AFFAIR Law-enforcement officials said investigators for the Whitewater independent counsel were checking the fingerprints on F.B.I. files improperly acquired by the White House. A11
SEEING MONEY IN ATLANTA Along with the scores of athletes converging on Atlanta will be a number of strippers looking to make money off visitors. A8
BIG FIGHT OVER WAGE VOTE Organized labor and business groups are waging an all-out lobbying campaign to influence a crucial Senate vote to raise the Federal minimum wage. A8
New Orleans Journal: An All-America City with foreign influence. A8 Engine parts were gathered from the Delta accident in Florida. A9

TANGLED WEB OF POLITICS For Gov. Christine Todd Whitman and Representative Richard A. Zimmer of New Jersey, and numerous other Republicans around the country, the road to political prominence runs through a spartan industrial park on the outskirts of Princeton, N.J. A1

A NICE PLACE TO VISIT. . . One of brightest spots in the region's economy, tourism in New York City is on the upswing, economists and city officials say. Hotel occupancy rates -- expected to reach nearly 80 percent this year -- have hit their highest levels in 16 years. A1

Bette Midler, and film crew, in Manhattan. C9 Music: The Boston Symphony Orchestra at Tanglewood. C9 Bargemusic. C10 "Paris: New Music 1896-1996," at the Sculpture Garden. C10 KRS-One at Tramps. C12 Books: "Nightline." C14 Television: A film maker captures the American West. C9

Baseball: Yanks lose to Brewers in Strawberry's return. C1 Expos edge Mets. C7 Basketball: Dream Team crushes Brazil. C2 Columns: Vecsey on MaliVai Washington. C4 Rhoden on Strawberry. C5 Olympics: Technology will hand out the medals at the Games. C3 Tennis: Krajicek beats Washington to win Wimbledon title. C1
William H. Kolberg, advocated labor improvements.
The huge new railroad menace. Turkey's Islamic Government. Mr. Vallone's tough sell.
Anthony Lewis: Crime and blunder. Bob Herbert: Can we talk? Condoleezza Rice: Now, NATO should grow. Frank Askin: "Filegate" may be good for us.
